posts.content: Just taken the seat covers off and found this material underneath. It looks like the original pattern, the material is in very good condition. Does anyone know if it is the original pattern, if so what was the curtain material like. It is from a 1967 devon. Thanks.

author.location: Bridgnorth, Shropshire. I am a member :o)

posts.content:
Yes - that's definitely the original Duracour material - looks like new!
Out of interest what colour is your bus?, as that depended on the interior material colour used generally.

If you open the zip and look at the material inside where the zip is hemmed in you will be able to tell if the material has faded any over the years.
(mine was originally a bright greeny/yellow, but faded to to manky beige over years - hahahahaha)
Thanks for the reply. The material looks the same inside the zip, the van is Titan Red and Beige Grey. I would think the seats have had a seat cover on for quite a while.

stevefhot wrote:Thanks for the reply. The material looks the same inside the zip, the van is Titan Red and Beige Grey. I would think the seats have had a seat cover on for quite a while.


Grey Duracour would be right for the van. Is this a deluxe van by chance? Duracour in that colour and condition is probably worth its weight in gold
Brian
Hello Brian, no its not a deluxe van

author.location: Bridgnorth, Shropshire. I am a member :o)

posts.content:
What ever you do, DO NOT chuck it away or anything like that, original unfaded Duracour material just doesnt exist anymore..... I'm sure you would'nt, or you would'nt be on here asking, but weve all seen Devon interiors scrapped, before owners have realised their true value......

As to your curtain colour question, I'm not sure what went with grey duracour, but someone will be along soon who will tell you exactly I would imagine.

Cheers,

I have a Devon 1967 interior book. I will photo. I know they did a red multi colour variant which MAY have been the choice. It would have been mine and would look a nice match with your VW OG colour way. I will add the photo here.
G
